p: In another study, testing of the bacteriostatic and bactericidal effects of EOs of T. satureioides leaves and flowering top on E. coli, S. aureus, A. baumannii, B. cereus, and Enterobacter cloacae revealed a significant antibacterial activity (inhibition zone diameters (Ф): 16 mm < Ф < 30.7 mm for leaves EOs; 22 mm < Ф < 45 mm for flowering top EOs) and a bacteriostatic effect against all tested strains except B. cereus [ 71].
